tasks.task: Check the battery of a combine harvester and perform preliminary maintenance.
subtasks: Approach the combine harvester.
Open the battery compartment to inspect the battery.
Check the battery's charge level using a multimeter or similar tool.
If necessary, charge the battery or replace it.
Check the fluid levels (oil, grease) and add as needed.
Lubricate moving parts to ensure smooth operation.
Tighten loose connections or bolts.
Clear any debris from the machinery.
Test the combine harvester's functions to ensure readiness for harvest.

tasks.task: Operate the combine harvester during the harvest season.
subtasks: Drive the combine harvester through the fields.
Adjust the combine's settings (speed, elevation, separator ...) based on crop conditions.
Monitor the grain elevator and auger systems to prevent blockages.
Clean debris from the combine's corresponded grates regularly.
Load harvested grain into trucks or bins, ensuring proper ventilation.
Perform periodic maintenance checks on the combine during operation.
Change knife blades on the header as needed to optimize cutting.

tasks.task: Conduct routine checks and maintenance on an air compressor.
subtasks: Identify the location of the air compressor on the farm.
Turn off the air compressor and release any stored pressure.
Unscrew the drain plug on the compressor tank to remove accumulated water and debris.
Lubricate moving parts inside the compressor.
Check the air filter for dirt and replace if necessary.
Tighten any loose bolts or connections on the compressor.
Adjust the pressure relief valve if it is excessively releasing air.

tasks.task: Install and adjust a SHB temple plough.
subtasks: Locate the SHB temple plough on the farm equipment shed.
Consult the owner's manual for proper installation instructions.
Secure the plough to the drawbar or implement carrier.
Set the plough depth using the adjustment mechanism.
Position the plough's angle for optimal soil disturbance.
Check the plough's blades for damage or wear.
Validate the plough's operation by performing a test run.

tasks.task: Assist in the removal of garden weeds using tools.
subtasks: Identify the garden areas requiring weeding.
Put on protective clothing and gloves.
Pick weeds by hand, starting from the base.
Use a hoe to loosen soil around stubborn weeds.
Employ a dandelion fork to dig out deep-rooted weeds.
Rake the disturbed soil and replant the area if necessary.

tasks.task: Prepare hay bales for storage.
subtasks: Load hay onto a baler.
Operate the baler to compress the hay into bales.
Move the bales to the storage area.
Arrange the bales on pallets or stacking sturdily.
Cover the bales with plastic or tarps to protect from moisture.

tasks.task: Participate in the hay chopping process.
subtasks: Drive the hay mower or conditioner across the field.
Set the mower's cutting height according to the crop height.
Monitor the hay's moisture content and adjust settings if needed.
Gather the chopped hay into windrows using a pickup or baler.
Secure the hay windrows for drying.

tasks.task: Assist during the planting of a soybean field.
subtasks: Choose the appropriate soybean seeds and load them into the planter box.
Attach the planter to the tractor or implement support.
Set the planter's depth and spacing.
Start the tractor and begin planting the soybeans in rows.
Monitor the planting speed and adjust throttles as needed.
Check planter settings after each pass to ensure accurate spacing and depth.

tasks.task: Assist with the bundling and hanging of vines from a tree.
subtasks: Locate the vines to be bundled and attached to the tree.
Prune the vines to desired length if necessary.
Use twine or rope to bundle the vines together at their base.
Position the bundled vines underneath the tree branches.
Secure the vine bundle to the tree trunk with additional rope or ties.

tasks.task: Conduct routine inspection of a water filtration system.
subtasks: Access the water filtration system's location on the farm.
Record the current water pressure and flow rates.
Check for any visible leaks in the system.
Inspect filters for dirt accumulation and replace if needed.
Verify the operation of the backwashing mechanism.
Check the system’s pH levels and adjust as necessary.

tasks.task: Monitor and adjust the tiling of a livestock area.
subtasks: Identify the livestock area needing tile adjustment.
Determine the direction of water flow on the pasture.
Dig trenches along the high water drainage areas.
Lay down tile pipes to intercept the flow.
Backfill the trenches and slope the surface for proper drainage.

tasks.task: Assist in the loading of a combine harvester with grain.
subtasks: Prepare the truck or bin to receive the grain.
Guide the combine harvester into position.
Lower the auger or conveyor to transfer grain into the transport.
Secure any hitches or couplings to prevent slipping.
Weigh the grain load if necessary for record-keeping.

tasks.task: Operate a tow truck to transport a heavy combine harvester.
subtasks: Inspect the combine harvester for any damages or issues before towing.
Attach the tow truck’s winch or hitch to the combine.
Test the connection to ensure it is secure.
Drive the tow truck while carefully maneuvering the combine behind.
Secure the chain or straps if using different methods.
Follow any traffic or field routes to the destination.

tasks.task: Check and adjust a wall segregator machine for seed cleaning.
subtasks: Open the wall segregator machine’s access panel.
Adjust the wire mesh screen to the appropriate size for the seeds.
Test the machine’s airflow settings for optimal separation.
Check the contamination levels and remove impurities by hand.
Lubricate any moving parts of the segregator.

tasks.task: Clean a tanker truck used for transporting milk.
subtasks: Drain any remaining milk from the tanker.
Clean the interior walls and floors with soap and water.
Sanitize the tanker with approved cleaning solutions.
Check the seals and doors for airtightness.
Inspect the truck’s brakes and other safety features.

tasks.task: Load a Chevrolet Suburban with hay bales using a forklift.
subtasks: Position the forklift at the hay bale stack.
Insert the forks between the bales, being careful not to clamp too tightly.
Lift the bales securely and move them to the Suburban.
Align the bales with the vehicle’s bed and carefully lower them.
Secure the hay bales with appropriate tie-downs or straps.

tasks.task: Assemble a tree support stand for a young sapling.
subtasks: Measure the appropriate height for the support stand.
Cut the stakes to the measured length, ensuring proper depth.
Hammer or stake the supports into the ground around the tree base.
Coil any excess rope or mesh used to wrap around the tree.
Wrap the tree trunk and lower branches with supporting material.

tasks.task: Adjust automatic vegetable planers for optimal product placement.
subtasks: Refer to the planer’s operation manual for setup instructions.
Set the distance between the product guides to match the desired spacing.
Verify the height adjustments to align with the customers or crops’ needs.
Test the planer’s operation, ensuring that products are placed correctly.

tasks.task: Operate a harvester to cut alfalfa for silage.
subtasks: Position the harvester in a field of mature alfalfa.
Adjust the cutting height to slice just above the soil line.
Moisture test the alfalfa in the field before cutting.
Set the drum speed and cutter bar diameter based on the crop thickness.
Monitor the swath geometry as it’s cut and turn the tractor appropriately.

tasks.task: Supervise the levelling of water channels using a levelling machine.
subtasks: Set up the levelling machine in the irrigation channel.
Operate the machine to analyze the channel’s current grade.
Use switches or controls to adjust the machine’s lift or lower sections.
Monitor the grade being achieved and make adjustments as needed.
Fine-tune the channel’s slope for optimal water flow.

tasks.task: Apply fertilizer to corn fields using a spreader.
subtasks: Fill the spreader with the correct type of fertilizer.
Adjust the spreader’s settings for the appropriate rate based on crop needs.
Attach the spreader to the tractor and position it over the field.
Operate the spreader’s mechanism to apply the fertilizer evenly.
Drive the tractor at the specified speed to ensure coverage.
Check the evenness of the application and make adjustments.

tasks.task: Prepare a truck for the transport of harvested potatoes.
subtasks: Inspect the truck’s loading area for any damage or obstructions.
Place the forks on the forklift and carefully load the potato bales.
Position the bales in the truck to avoid blocking the tailgate.
Secure the bales with straps or stretch wrap for stability.
Close the tailgate and check all sides for securement.
Cover the load with a tarp if needed to prevent damage.

tasks.task: Operate a slinky machine to collect hay after bailing.
subtasks: Attach the slinky machine to the baling operator.
Adjust the distance between the slinky’s coils for crop spacing.
Start the machine and monitor its performance as it collects and stores the hay.
Stop the machine periodically to clean impurities from the coils.

tasks.task: Inspect the handling of bagged straw being loaded onto a truck.
subtasks: Approach the truck and bin edge where the straw is being loaded.
Check the stability of the individual bales as they are lifted and placed.
Inspect the straps or cords used to secure the bales in the truck bed.
Verify that there are no gaps or instability that could lead to shifting during transport.

tasks.task: Assist in the construction of a wall surrounding a silage field.
subtasks: Excavate the foundation for the wall where planned.
Lay the concrete blocks or stones along the perimeter.
Mortar the joints between blocks or apply sealant as needed.
Backfill the gaps around the base for stability.
Apply a protective coating or paint to the finished wall.

tasks.task: Ensure that a roll of plastic for silage storage is properly rolled and stored.
subtasks: Lay out the plastic sheet on a flat surface, ensuring it is smooth.
Pin down the edges of the plastic to anchor it in place.
Roll the plastic into a storage location, such as a shed or under cover.
Stack additional rolls neatly for future use.
